title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
description: Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
OB: When invoking the New Java Package feature, a message appears at the top that says 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message appears even before any package name is entered. It is unclear what this message means and whether it is an error or a warning. It is suggested to display this message in red with an error icon.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package feature, no error or warning message should appear when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled. It is recommended to clarify the meaning of the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' and provide appropriate feedback to the user.
SR: To reproduce the issue, invoke the New Java Package feature. Observe the message that appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even when the package name field is empty.
